headline: Rockwell Automation Stock Dips After Earnings Beat: Why Bulls See a Fast Rebound
summary: Rockwell Automation is well-positioned to automate total returns, with a bullish stock price outlook, share buybacks, dividends, and distribution growth.

headline: Rockwell Automation price target raised to $450 from $430 at BofA
summary: BofA raised the firm’s price target on Rockwell Automation (ROK) to $450 from $430 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares, noting that the company beat consensus revenue and EPS for the fourth consecutive quarter. FY26 adjusted EPS guidance was walked up, but management held the 2%-6% year-over-year organic sales guidance in what the firm calls a “conservative stance on guidance.”Claim 50% Off TipRanks PremiumUnlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions

headline: Rockwell Automation (ROK) Valuation Check After Earnings Beat And Upgraded Profit Outlook
summary: Rockwell Automation (ROK) is back in focus after reporting fiscal first quarter results that topped earnings and revenue expectations, along with a higher full year profit outlook and continued share repurchases. See our latest analysis for Rockwell Automation. The earnings beat and higher profit outlook arrived as Rockwell Automation’s share price reached US$415.02, with a 90 day share price return of 11.12% and a 1 year total shareholder return of 57.15%, suggesting momentum has been...
